div.span: The Public Hearing on the District 2020-2021 Budget scheduled for May 11 has been postponed. The May 11th meeting agenda will now include the Superintendent and Board of Education annual evaluations.

span.p: If you experience difficulty accessing any information on this website please notify Tina Winslow at 716-326-2151 ext 217 or email her at twinslow@westfieldcsd.org The District requests that you provide your name, email address, phone number, a description of the problem you experienced, and the location of the information you tried to access.

span.p: Governor Cuomo issued an extension of NYS school closings until May 15. Meals and instruction will continue during this time. Please call 326-2196 for meal delivery or email us at wacs.support@westfieldcsd.org with any needs.

a.title: Go to comments for Extension of School Closing

span.p: Governor Cuomo issued an extension of NYS school closings until April 29. Meals and instruction will continue during this time, including Spring Recess. Please call 326-2196 for meal delivery or email us at wacs.support@westfieldcsd.org with any needs.

a.title: Go to comments for 4/6

span.p: In compliance with the Governor’s order to continue school closures through April 14, WACS will continue to provide education remotely. The order requires schools and WACS to provide education during our previously scheduled recess. We will provide education for the duration of our scheduled recess and support our families. Our staff will maintain regular communication with students and families. We continue to monitor the health crisis and will notify our families of any changes that may occur.

Our food service team and transportation teams are preparing meals for our students to extend through our recess. Families will receive a larger portion of food the week prior to meet the nutritional needs of our students during the week of April 13. If possible, please be prepared with a box or cooler located on your porch for our staff to place that food inside. Also, please be prepared to store this quantity of food. If you have not signed up to receive meals for your student(s), please contact 326-2196 for assistance.
Please continue to visit our Facebook page, webpage and listen for our voice messaging system to receive updates.

a.title: Go to comments for Update 4/3

p.span: You may access the COVID-19 information on the COVID-19 tab displayed above.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Information

span.span: “With a commitment to excellence, Westfield Academy and Central School, in partnership with the community, will educate all students to the highest level of their academic potentials, teaching them the skills and knowledge to become capable and responsible members of society. We will provide all students with a range of challenging educational opportunities in a safe, supportive environment that fosters honesty, integrity and respect for self and others."

span.strong: Accredited by the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools
